title: Basic Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 4 garlic cloves, peeled and thinly sliced
3 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme; or, 1 tablespoon dried
instructions: In a 3-quart saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.  Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is soft and a light golden brown, from  to 10 minutes.  Add the thyme and shredded carrot and cook everything for 5 minutes more or until the carrot is quite soft.  With your hands crush the tomatoes and add them with their juices.  Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring often, and then lower the heat and simmer everything for 30 minutes or until the sauce is as thick as “hot cereal”.  Season with salt and serve.
This sauce will hold for up to 1 week in the refrigerator or up to six months if its frozen and kept in a freezer.
source: The Babbo Cookbook by Mario Batali, published by Clarkson Potter/Publishers, , © 2002 by Mario Batali.
